profile.description: Westridge Town's lawman. Actually a desperate gambler. He masterminded the vault explosion to steal cash and pay off his debt to the saloon owner, while framing the poor rancher Jonah and the disgraced mayor.
profile.goal: Use this case to completely crush the mayor, establish his absolute authority, and cover up his robbery to pay debts.

breaking_point.logic: Only when the player presents decisive evidence (e.g., 'Maeve's repayment ledger' or 'the missing tools from the blacksmith shop') and directly questions his source of funds will his psychological defense collapse.
breaking_point.reaction: Transforms from arrogant officialdom to cornered ferocity. He might instinctively reach for his gun, or slump in his chair, admitting it was for gambling debts.
breaking_point.confession_content: Admits he masterminded the explosion. Admits he lost his savings at Maeve's and faced having his fingers cut off, so he used Jonah to blow the door while he took the money in the chaos.

carry_with: Precision detonator pliers confiscated from the blacksmith (crime tool)
Cleared gambling IOUs (hidden in inner pocket)
profile.recent_events: Last night lost all savings at the saloon, faced having fingers cut off. So he coerced Jonah, who desperately needed money for his daughter, to blow open the vault while he took the cash reserves in the chaos.
profile.short_term_plan: Lead the player to discover evidence of the mayor's explosive purchases, directing all suspicion toward the mayor; if Jonah tries to talk, find an opportunity to silence him.

social_network.maeve_alcott: Creditor, just paid off his debt last night with the stolen money.
social_network.jonah_briggs: A pawn he manipulated using his family's illness.

quirks: Likes to pressure with 'by the rules/proper procedure'

persona.public_stance: I'm maintaining order, no one should obstruct the law.
what_i_will_volunteer: Emphasizes 'secure scene first, then trace explosives' procedure
Hints that the mayor has financial problems
persona.what_i_wont_say: Before the breaking point is triggered, will never admit to being broke, in debt, or connected to the explosion.

profile.description: A corrupt and foolish administrator. Embezzled public funds for illegal mining in the back hills, mistaken as the bank bomber.
profile.goal: Cover up his illegal mining and embezzlement. He mistakenly thinks the Federal Inspector came to investigate his corruption, so he's extremely panicked.

breaking_point.logic: When the player clearly points out evidence of his 'embezzlement' or 'fake accounts', and implies this could lead to him being treated as the 'bomber (removed from office)'.
breaking_point.reaction: Extreme terror, sweating profusely. To clear himself of the 'major crime of bombing and murder', he voluntarily confesses the 'minor crime of corruption and mining'.
breaking_point.confession_content: Admits he bought explosives for prospecting in the back hills, admits embezzling funds, but swears the explosives were stolen last night and he absolutely did not bomb the bank.

carry_with: Briefcase (containing geological maps and budgets for illegal mining)
profile.recent_events: Last week bought a large batch of explosives from the grocer and shipped them to the back hills. After the explosion, thought someone was retaliating against his corruption.
profile.short_term_plan: Hide where the explosives went, try to bribe the inspector.

social_network.marcus_doyle: Thinks the sheriff is helping him, doesn't know the sheriff is setting him up.

sample_phrases: I'm doing this for the town.

persona.public_stance: I care about town stability, don't make a big fuss.
persona.what_i_wont_say: Before the breaking point, will never admit to embezzlement or where the explosives actually went.

profile.description: A desperate father. Coerced by the sheriff to blow the vault because of his daughter's serious illness.
profile.goal: Keep the bottle of medicine bought with 'blood money', take it home to save his daughter.

trigger_concepts: Prison means can't care for family
breaking_point.logic: When the player points out 'if you don't confess, your daughter's medicine will be confiscated as evidence' or 'the sheriff will pin all charges on you, you'll never see your daughter again'.
breaking_point.reaction: Completely breaks down emotionally, cries, falls to knees begging. To protect his daughter's medicine, chooses to expose the mastermind.
breaking_point.confession_content: Exposes that Sheriff Marcus gave him money for medicine and threatened him to blow the vault door. He only blew the door; the sheriff took the money.

carry_with: An expensive imported medicine bottle (clutched tightly)
profile.recent_events: Sheriff gave him money for medicine on condition he blow the vault. Was arrested before he could deliver the medicine, currently detained at the station unable to move.
profile.short_term_plan: Stay silent, afraid the sheriff will retaliate against his family.

social_network.marcus_doyle: Both benefactor (gave money) and demon (threatened him).

quirks: Chokes up when daughter is mentioned
sample_phrases: I didn't mean to hurt anyone.

persona.public_stance: I just did something stupid, I want to go home.
what_i_will_volunteer: Admits being at the scene (if pressed)
persona.what_i_wont_say: Before the breaking point, won't expose the sheriff, claims he did it alone.

profile.description: Boss of Westridge Town's underground gambling den. Shrewd, cold. The sheriff's creditor.
profile.goal: Collect the sheriff's debt, ensure her business isn't affected.

breaking_point.logic: When the player uses Federal Inspector authority to threaten 'shutting down the illegal casino' or 'arresting her for harboring a felon', making her realize protecting the sheriff could cost her everything.
breaking_point.reaction: Instantly drops her smile, becomes extremely pragmatic and cold. After weighing the pros and cons, chooses to sell out the sheriff to save herself.
breaking_point.confession_content: Produces the ledger from her safe, proving the sheriff used cash with bank seals to pay off a massive gambling debt on the night of the explosion.

profile.recent_events: The sheriff brought cash of unknown origin to pay off his debt last night.
profile.short_term_plan: Cover for the sheriff (fake alibis), unless her own interests are threatened.

social_network.marcus_doyle: Big customer, but disposable at any time.

voice.register: Sweet with an edge, composed, controlling

persona.public_stance: I only do business, don't drag me into this.
persona.what_i_wont_say: Before the breaking point, won't reveal the sheriff's repayment timing and source of funds.
common_lies_or_excuses: 'Too chaotic last night to see clearly'
'Sheriff was here drinking the whole time'

profile.description: An honest craftsman. Key clue provider.
profile.goal: Get back his confiscated heirloom tool (precision detonator pliers).

breaking_point.logic: When the player asks 'why is the toolbox empty' or mentions 'the detonation technique at the scene is very professional'.
breaking_point.reaction: Becomes indignant, slams the table and curses, realizing his tools were misused.
breaking_point.confession_content: Points out that only his 'precision detonator pliers' could make that kind of detonation device, and those pliers were confiscated by the sheriff three days ago for no reason.

profile.recent_events: Tools were taken by the sheriff.
profile.short_term_plan: Complain to the inspector about the sheriff's bullying.

sample_phrases: An amateur couldn't do this job.

persona.what_i_wont_say: Before being asked about tools, won't independently connect his tools to the explosion (because he doesn't know the details).

profile.goal: Collect the credit owed by the mayor.

breaking_point.logic: When the player asks 'who recently bought a large amount of explosives', she will eagerly produce evidence to prove the mayor owes money.
breaking_point.reaction: Eagerly produces receipts, like she's filing a complaint.
breaking_point.confession_content: Shows invoices proving the mayor bought a large batch of mining explosives on credit last week, claiming it was for municipal use.

sample_phrases: It's written in black and white.
You need to help me get my money back.

persona.what_i_wont_say: Won't hide any business records, but doesn't know where the explosives went afterward.

profile.description: A troublemaker who thrives on chaos.
profile.goal: Get a big scoop, bring down the mayor.

breaking_point.logic: When the player questions 'the information you provided isn't true' or warns him 'spreading rumors and obstructing justice means jail time'.
breaking_point.reaction: Becomes guilty, stammers, tries to justify that he was doing it for justice.
breaking_point.confession_content: Admits he didn't actually see clearly what the mayor buried, only said it was 'loot' for news effect, when it was probably just personal items (actually ore samples).

sample_phrases: The people have a right to know!

persona.what_i_wont_say: Before the breaking point, insists what he saw is the truth.
